report.title: Not Thrilling, But Nice
report.author: Spicerack-F
report.bodytext: For the past two days I have spent the better part of my waking hours on diphenhydramine, and I enjoyed almost every minute of it. The more I read about its dangers, the more that worries me. /n /n I had never used diphenhydramine before except as a sleep aid in the recommended dose. I wasn't using any other drug at the time, except caffeinated soft drinks with meals, and my usual quota of cigarettes. /n /n What follows is adapted from the notes I took at the time: /n /n Tuesday /n 4:00 a.m. /n Took 5 Maximum Strength Sominex -- at 50mg diphenhydramine to a caplet, that's 250mg in all. I may take more in an hour. I'm going to go out for a smoke. /n /n 4:33 /n I'm watching a movie on TV. No noticeable effects yet. /n /n 4:55 /n Slight loss of balance (I may be imagining it): I stood up and found myself lurching sideways. /n /n 5:00 /n I've taken another 250mg. /n /n 5:06 /n A slight, almost imperceptible sensation of warmth in my abdomen; I also feel definitely light-headed. /n /n 5:40 /n Light-headedness is more pronounced. I am only slightly drowsy. The experience so far is comparable to a 1st-plateau DXM trip or a mild drunk. /n /n 5:46 /n My pulse is normal, but weak. I feel slightly warm. /n /n 6:04 /n The drowsiness is delicious. Only, I keep *almost* falling asleep, then snapping out of it with a start. /n /n I just heard three computer-like beeps, one long and two short. I think it is an hallucination; there isn't anything in this room that normally beeps. /n /n I know I should not by lying down, but I am anyway. I'm trying not to fall asleep, though. /n /n My legs feel as though they were about to cramp up. /n /n 6:53 /n It's getting harder and harder to stay awake. /n /n My stomach is uncomfortable. Not painful, and not exactly nauseous, but *uncomfortable*. The rest of my body feels the same way, though not as bad; still, I can't find a comfortable postion to lie in. /n /n 5:18 p.m. /n And sure enough, I let myself sleep -- a long, dead, heavy sleep, but surprisingly refreshing. /n /n 10:15 /n I'm trying this again: 5 left-over Sominex and 8 store-brand softgels of the same potency, 750mg in all. /n /n 11:16 /n No noticeable effects yet. /n /n Wednesday /n 12:15 a.m. /n Still no noticeable effects. Perhaps I should have taken it on an empty stomach. /n /n 12:38 /n I'm feeling *something* now -- a kind of wooziness. I'm going to take one more softgel. /n /n 1:41 /n I've taken yet another softgel, bringing the total to 750mg. Effects are obvious now, but disappointingly mild. /n /n 1:51 /n This has been happening for a while: any sudden noise makes me tense up. *Any* sudden noise, from the elevator bell to people laughing on TV. /n /n 1:57 /n I keep hearing little tapping and clicking noises. I do not know if they are real or not, but they still make me shudder involuntarily. /n /n 2:43 /n My hands are *light*. It's rather the same sensation you get when you pick up a cup you think is full, only to jerk it two feet in the air because it was empty, after all. /n /n 4:43 /n About an hour ago I was sitting, smoking, out in front of the dorm and suddenly I smelled pot. It was only for a moment, though, and there was nobody around and no apparent source for the smell. /n /n I decided to walk to the computer lab. As I was walking, I saw several people standing in the distance. (It occured to me that they might be the pot smokers.) As I came closer, they disappeared, leaving only one. He was standing behind some shrubbery, so I could only see his head and shoulders. /n /n As I came closer still, the man's head disappeared and in its place there was a white folding chair standing on top of an outdoor table. /n /n I'm back in my room now. The effects have largely worn off, though cottonmouth, and a kind of tired feeling in my muscles, persist. /n /n 5:01 /n One thing I forgot to mention, but probably should: this stuff has been playing havoc with my memory. I'd be in the middle of a train of thought, and suddenly my mind would go blank -- leaving me wondering what I had been thinking about only a few seconds before. /n /n 4:18 p.m. /n I fell asleep shortly after that last entry, and woke up about half an hour ago. I have 300mg left, which I've decided to go ahead and take. /n /n 5:36 /n It kicked in while I was eating supper about 15 minutes ago. /n /n For 'only' 300mg, this is surprisingly strong -- it almost feels stronger than the 750mg last night. My head and limbs feel light, as they did before, and I have the sensation of something thick and heavy wrapped around the top of my head. /n /n My memory is going again, too. /n /n 8:23 /n Effects held steady, neither increasing nor decreasing, until shortly before 8. Then they tapered off very quickly, and now I feel no more than the slightest intoxication. /n /n Of course, I frittered the experience away watching TV. When will I learn?
